meanings.definition: To allow someone to enter a place or institution again after they have been asked to leave.
meanings.sent1: The school decided to readmit the student after he apologized for his behavior.
meanings.sent2: The committee voted to readmit the member who had previously been expelled.
meanings.sent3: The library had to readmit the noisy patron after he promised to keep quiet.
meanings.sent4: The theater decided to readmit the actor after his impressive performance in the audition.
meanings.sent5: The zoo had to readmit the escaped monkey back into its enclosure.

meanings.definition: To accept someone back into a group or organization after they have been removed or excluded.
meanings.sent1: The team captain decided to readmit the player who had been suspended for breaking the rules.
meanings.sent2: The club agreed to readmit the member who had previously resigned.
meanings.sent3: The committee had to readmit the forgetful treasurer after he misplaced the funds.
meanings.sent4: The company chose to readmit the experienced employee after realizing their mistake in letting them go.
meanings.sent5: The group had to readmit the lost hiker back into their expedition.
